{"step_by_step_thinking": "The most frequently used restorative material can be determined by considering the current trends in dentistry and the properties of each material. Silicate is not commonly used as a restorative material due to its low strength and poor aesthetics. Gold is a durable and long-lasting material, but it is not frequently used due to its high cost. Amalgam has been a popular choice for many years due to its strength, durability, and cost-effectiveness. However, in recent years, composite materials have gained popularity due to their improved aesthetics and ability to bond to tooth structure. Therefore, the most frequently used restorative material is likely to be C. Composite.", "answer_choice": "C"}
